security: Disclosing operational details regarding AMCLOCK/1, a human asset, could jeopardize their safety and compromise ongoing intelligence operations. Explicitly, 'AMCLOCK/1 was not seen going in or out of the room and the NATIONS meeting was conducted without interruption under most secure conditions. DI GERVENO established immediate rapport with AMCLOCK/1 and their relations remained most cordial throughout the meeting. Only DI GERVENO and AMCLOCK/1 were present.' Revealing secure meeting protocols and AMCLOCK/1's identity poses significant risks.
summary: This dispatch concerns the transmittal of contact reports regarding meetings between Peter J. DI GERVENO and AMCLOCK/1 in New York, detailing operational chronologies and intelligence gathered.
summary_one_paragraph: This dispatch, dated October 13, 1967, transmits contact reports from Peter J. DI GERVENO/JMWAVE concerning his first two meetings with the asset AMCLOCK/1, held on September 26 and 27 in New York. The reports detail the arrangements made to contact AMCLOCK/1, who had failed to make contact as instructed, and recount AMCLOCK/1â€™s operational chronology, including his criticism of living conditions in PBRUMEN, his reasons for not making prior contact, and his belief that his wife opposes the AMTHUG regime; the reports also provide information on internal security within the PBRUMEN mission and AMCLOCK/1's financial transactions. The document specifies future meeting plans and disseminates intelligence on PBRUMEN government attitudes towards the United States, views on specific individuals, and objectives of the AMTHUG regime.
title: Transmittal of Contact Resorts for First Two Meetings with AMCLOCK/1
recipient: Chief, WH/Cuba; COS, JMWAVE; Chief, DOD; Chief of Base, New York
